div.head: Walter Bayne Will
div.p:
In the name of God Ame. I Walter Beane of Charles County
in the provenance of Maryland planter being weak in body but be
God of a perfect and sound mind and memory do make and constitute
this to be my last will testament hereby nulling and revoking all other
heretofore made by me committing my body to the dust and my soule into
the hands of my mereceful and faithfull Creator and redeemour and
disposing of my worldly Estate as followeth

I give and bequeath unto my sonne John Beane all that parallel and portion
of land now in my possession & in the present, occupation of Edward Aplebey
and Thomas Bellenby situate and lying in St. Maries County by Estimation
one thousand acres and that the said John shall have the full
of it when he shall arrive at the full age of one and twenty years
I give unto my sonne John that which is my now dwelling
plantation by estimation 4 hundred and 50 acres of land provided
always that my lo. wife Ellenor for the term of her natural life shall
profits
profets and enjoy the same to her proper benefit and use
I give also unto my said son John one negro called Balloy
seele ring a silver coupe and half a dozen silver spoons with that stock
of cattle of horses which or are commonly called his provided
always that my wife Ellenor shall have liberty to sell and disperse
of all or any of the horses or cattle for the said Johns benefiit or use
Item I give unto my eldest daughter Judith the present wife of Mr. Matthew Hill all
my right title and interest in the late purchase which I have made of 3 hundred
acres of land situate and giving in Charles County with the river
Nueocomoes on the month John Caigeo on the East near to my
now dwelling plantation on the West. Lately in the possession of Robert Long
willing and desiring that the patent may in his or her name provided
always that my wife Ellenor shall have liberty to fall or carry away
of timber growing upon the said plantation for her own but only for her
proper and particular and use.

Item I given unto my said daughter Judith all and the goods and
or stock of cattle and which are or have been at any time called hers
Item I given unto my second daughter Elizabeth all that parallel land by estimation
3 hundred acres situate lying in Paterson near to Mr. Thomas Truemons
plantation one moyity of which was taken up by myself the other hundred and
bought of Thomas Billiby Welling and Desiring that the patent for the same
land may be in her name

Item I give unto the aforesaid Elizabeth one negro called Mingo half a dozen of silver
spoons with all that of called or other goods which have been or are called
or refuted hers.

Item I give unto my third and youngest Daughter Eleanor all that parallel of land
containing by estimation seven hundred and 50 acres situate and lying near to
or about the head of Port Tobacco creek with patent belonging now in the
possession of my wife taken ad her heirs forever

Item I give unto the said Eleanor that estate of cattle or horses which commonly
have been or called and reputed hers with one negro woman called Mingoes wife
all and singular the remainder of my lands goods chattle or household they with
all my bills bonds and debts whatsoever I leave to the sole dis of my lov. wife
Ellenor either in her life time or at her Death which I entrale and will her faithfully
to
to disperse of and amongst my aforesaid children hereby making constitute
and appoint the said Ellenor to be sole Executor of this my last will and
Testament in testimony whereof I have hereto put my hand and seal this
twelfth day of April ano Domino 1670.

Signed sealed and Delivered as his last
will and testament in the presents of us
Matthew Hill
his mark
John Long
his
Edward Nibbs
mark
Ammend to the forgoing will was the following to with
28th May 1670 the above written last will and testament of Matthew Bayne
was by the oaths of Matthew Hill, John Long and Edward Nibbs
his Mattew Bayne mark
in common form proved before me the day and year above said
7 ¼? Sides
Will Calvert
